law.catch_line: (Repealed effective October 1, 2012) When court may appoint temporary guardians; bond; powers and duties.
law.text: Until a guardian appointed by the court or clerk has given bond, or while there is no guardian, the court or clerk may, from time to time, appoint a temporary guardian, who shall give bond as aforesaid, and during the continuance of his guardianship have all the powers and perform all the duties of a guardian, and be responsible in the same way.
